intro: Scleropyrum wallichianum var. siamense, commonly known as the Siam sandmat, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its unique morphology and habitat preferences make it an interesting subject for botanical study. The species is also valued for its potential medicinal properties.
